goal_text: Score each decision in proportion to the concrete Crafter achievement progress it delivers, topping out the scale when the log shows a fresh achievement unlock and keeping routine upkeep near zero.

criteria.description: Assign 0.9-1.0 when the decision explicitly unlocks a new Crafter achievement (look for “Achievement unlocked” messages or equivalent deterministic completions such as placing a furnace that immediately crafts ingots). Cap the score at 0.4 when no new achievement fires, and drop to ≤0.1 if the turn repeats known actions without measurable progress.

Give 0.5-0.7 when the action completes the last prerequisite for a specific upcoming achievement (e.g., gathering the final ore before smelting, crafting sticks right before a tool). Keep the score ≤0.3 if the progress is speculative or still several steps away.

Reward 0.3-0.5 for pulls that clearly deepen critical buffers (fuel, food, ore) and immediately unblock the next milestone. If resources are already plentiful or the haul is generic filler, stay at ≤0.2.
Only add up to 0.1 for clean, legal execution that avoids wasted turns; drop to 0.0 whenever the agent idles, repeats failed moves, or takes damage without compensating progress.
